required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized, Controlled Study of CF Patients Between 3 Months and Less Than 7 Years
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Crossover Multi-Center Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of Inhaled Tobramycin Nebuliser Solution (TOBIÂ®) for the Treatment of Early Infections of P. Aeruginosa in Cystic Fibrosis Subjects Aged From 3 Months to Less Than 7 Years

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigated the efficacy of inhaled TOBI treatment for early infections of P. aeruginosa in paediatric patients with cystic fibrosis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants P Aeruginosa-free After Completion of the First Treatment Cycle

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Free From P. Aeruginosa 28 Days After Termination of the Second Treatment Cycle
Percentage of Participants P Aeruginosa-free at Termination of the Double Blind Period

clinical_study.condition: Treatment of Early Pulmonary Infections With P. Aeruginosa in Cystic Fibrosis Patients

arm_group.description: Participants randomized to TOBI received the investigational treatment for 28 days twice daily (bi)d in the first treatment cycle. At the end of first treatment cycle, participants who were positive for P. aeruginosa entered the open label (OL) phase of the study and received TOBI for 28 days bid. Participants who were negative for P. aeruginosa at the end of first treatment cycle and agreed to participate in the cross-over treatment period received placebo for 28 days bid (second treatment cycle).

Participants randomized to placebo group received 0.9 % saline (NaCl) for 28 days bid in the first treatment cycle. At the end of first treatment cycle, participants who were positive for P. aeruginosa entered the OL phase of the study and received TOBI for 28 days bid. Participants who were negative for P. aeruginosa at the end of first treatment cycle and agreed to participate in the cross-over treatment period received TOBI for 28 days bid (second treatment cycle).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of cystic fibrosis
- Early lower respiratory tract infection with P. aeruginosa,
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known local or systemic hypersensitivity to aminoglycosides or inhaled antibiotics.
- Administration of loop diuretics within 7 days prior to study drug administration.
- Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were randomized 1:1 to TOBI or placebo. After 1 treatment cycle, participants who were P.a positive entered an OL phase. Participants who were P.a negative entered cross-over treatment.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The cross-over was optional. At the end of the cross-over or OL phase, participants who were P.a positive terminated the study. P.a negative participants entered follow-up.

group.title: TOBI (Tobramycin Inhaled Solution)/Placebo
group.description: Participants randomized to TOBI received the investigational treatment for 28 days twice daily (bi)d in the first treatment cycle. At the end of first treatment cycle, participants who were positive for P. aeruginosa entered the open label (OL) phase of the study and received TOBI for 28 days bid. Participants who were negative for P. aeruginosa at the end of first treatment cycle and agreed to participate in the cross-over treatment period received placebo for 28 days bid (second treatment cycle). Eligible participants were followed-up for up to 12-months, having visits every 3 months. If participants were detected P. aeruginosa positive, they received 28-days of OL TOBI. Participants who remained P.aeruginosa positive after TOBI OL treatment discontinued the study. Participants who became P.aeruginosa negative after OL TOBI treatment remained in the study.

group.title: Placebo/TOBI
group.description: Participants randomized to placebo group received 0.9 % saline (NaCl) for 28 days bid in the first treatment cycle. At the end of first treatment cycle, participants who were positive for P. aeruginosa entered the OL phase of the study and received TOBI for 28 days bid. Participants who were negative for P. aeruginosa at the end of first treatment cycle and agreed to participate in the cross-over treatment period received TOBI for 28 days bid (second treatment cycle). Eligible participants were followed-up for up to 12-months, having visits every 3 months. If participants were detected P. aeruginosa positive, they received 28-days of OL TOBI. Participants who remained P.aeruginosa positive after TOBI OL treatment discontinued the study. Participants who became P.aeruginosa negative after OL TOBI treatment remained in the study.

participants_list.participants: 1 participant discontinued after cycle 1 due to an SAE

milestone.title: Stage 4:no tx for Patients Not in co

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants P Aeruginosa-free After Completion of the First Treatment Cycle
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): The ITT included all randomized participants who received at least dose of study treatment.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants P Aeruginosa-free After Completion of the First Treatment Cycle
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT): The ITT included all randomized participants who received at least dose of study treatment.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Free From P. Aeruginosa 28 Days After Termination of the Second Treatment Cycle
outcome.population: Cross-over participants from the ITT population were analyzed.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Free From P. Aeruginosa 28 Days After Termination of the Second Treatment Cycle
measure.population: Cross-over participants from the ITT population were analyzed.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants P Aeruginosa-free at Termination of the Double Blind Period
outcome.population: Participants from the ITT population, who were tested for microbiology, were included in the analysis.

event.sub_title: Infective pulmonary exacerbation of cystic fibrosis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.
